title: Calories in Chicken BBQ
meta_description: Discover calories in chicken bbq per 100g, including protein, fat, carbs, sodium from sauce, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Skinless chicken breast, grilled and basted with moderate BBQ sauce; cooked weight, no added sides.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, sauce brand, cooking method, and portion size. Check labels or apps for exact values.

quick_answer.text: 100g of barbecued chicken provides ~200 kcal, with high protein and some added carbs from sauce.

label_note: Values align with Nutrition Facts panels for straightforward comparison to packaged foods.

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g chicken bbq?
What's the protein in chicken bbq?
faqs.a: About 25g per 100g, making it a lean protein source.

faqs.q: Does BBQ sauce add a lot of sodium to chicken?
faqs.a: Yes, around 450mg per 100g due to sauce; opt for low-sodium versions.

faqs.q: Calories in chicken bbq vs plain grilled?
faqs.a: BBQ adds ~40 kcal per 100g from sauce sugars and flavors.

faqs.q: Is chicken bbq high in fat?
faqs.a: Moderate at 8g per 100g; skinless breast keeps it lower than dark meat.
